metadata.title: CVE-2021-38508 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
By displaying a form validity message in the correct location at the same time as a permission prompt (such as for geolocation), the validity message could have obscured the prompt, resulting in the user potentially being tricked into granting the permission. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 94, Thunderbird < 91.3, and Firefox ESR < 91.3.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-38508` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 94.0+build3-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
firefox-geckodriver - 94.0+build3-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 94.0+build3-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required
